page.title: 06Clifford Farm and Bridge _2_
page.content: The caravan site provides a good range of facilities including a swimming pool and small zoo. It is situated on the river Teign, has spaces for eighty tents and caravans, and is popular for its scenic surroundings, isolation,and easy accessibility to the Dartmoor National Park. Fishing is permitted by licence obtainable from the Fingle Bridge Park Information Centre.Many of the campers and caravaners return each year,and despite the poor weather of the summer of 1985,the site was fairly full during August although the weather deterred many possible campers with tents. Apart from the site owners, there are less than six other permanent residents, most of whom have moved there from other parts of Britain. They live in houses mostly converted from some of the farm buildings. Only one is a Devonian.
